intro: Noltea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants typically have showy yellow or orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Noltea species are often found in grasslands and rocky habitats, thriving in full sun. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
